author: Simon Rimmer
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/400F/Gas 6. For the cookies, place the butter, sugar, water and egg into a large bowl and mix together well. Sift the flour, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and salt into the bowl and mix well to form a dough. Fold in the chocolate chips. Roll out the cookie dough onto a clean, floured work surface and, using a cookie cutter, cut into 10cm/4in circles. Decorate each cookie with sugar-coated chocolates and place onto a greased baking tray. Transfer to the oven to bake for 9-10 minutes, or until cooked through. Meanwhile, for the chocolate sauce, place the butter, sugar, cream, cocoa powder, water and chocolate into a pan over a low heat and stir until  combined. Cook gently for 4-5 minutes until thick and glossy. To serve, place one cookie onto each plate. Add a large spoonful of ice cream and sandwich with a second cookie on top. Drizzle with chocolate sauce and serve.
ingredients: 75ml/2½oz butter, melted, plus extra for greasing,  250g/9oz soft dark brown sugar,  1 tbsp water,  1 free-range egg,  325g/11oz plain flour, plus extra for dusting,  half tsp baking powder,  half tsp bicarbonate of soda,  pinch salt,  150g/5oz chocolate chips (available from supermarkets and baking shops),  crisp-coated chocolates (such as Smarties or M&Ms), to decorate,  75g/2½oz butter,  75g/2½oz sugar ,  75ml/2½fl oz double cream,  75g/2½oz cocoa powder,  75ml/2½fl oz water ,  75g/2½oz dark chocolate, chopped,  vanilla ice cream
